author: Giorgia Cavicchioli
title: Previsão do tempo: tempestades atingem todo o Brasil nesta sexta-feira, dia 13
text:
13/12/2024 - 5:00
A previsão do tempo para esta sexta-feira, dia 13, mostra que tempestades devem atingir todo o Brasil. O Inmet (Instituto Nacional de Meteorologia) emitiu um alerta para perigos potenciais relacionados às precipitações. No Norte e no Centro-Oeste do Brasil, as chuvas fortes devem dominar todos os Estados das regiões.
No Nordeste, as tempestades devem atingir Maranhão, Piauí e Bahia. No Sul do País, a previsão é para que as chuvas fortes se concentrem na área Norte e Oeste do Paraná. Os outros Estados devem estar seguros e não devem ter perigos potenciais para a população local.
No Sudeste, as áreas afetadas devem ser: Sul/Sudoeste de Minas, Zona da Mata, Campo das Vertentes, Noroeste Fluminense, Centro Fluminense, Vale do Paraíba Paulista, Sul Fluminense, Metropolitana do Rio de Janeiro e Norte Fluminense.
As áreas citadas devem sofrer com chuva entre 20 e 30 mm/h ou até 50 mm/dia e ventos bastante intensos (40-60 km/h). No entanto, existe baixo risco de corte de energia elétrica, queda de galhos de árvores, alagamentos e de descargas elétricas.
Mesmo assim, as autoridades fazem alguns alertas para a população e pedem para que elas sigam as seguintes instruções durante as chuvas:
- Em caso de rajadas de vento, não se abrigue debaixo de árvores, pois há leve risco de queda e descargas elétricas;
- Não estacione veículos próximos a torres de transmissão e placas de propaganda;
- Evite usar aparelhos eletrônicos ligados à tomada.

author: newsdesk@grimsbytelegraph.co.uk (Lauren Davidson)
title: 'Glowing red and orange sky' like 'something from a film' seen across northern Lincolnshire
text: Residents across northern Lincolnshire and even those living across the River Humber were left astounded by a glowing amber and red sky on Friday night. From around 5pm until the early hours of the next morning, a huge flare could be seen coming from a tower at the Prax Lindsey Oil Refinery in [Immingham](https://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/all-about/immingham), as well as thick plumes of black smoke. Residents in Grimsby and Cleethorpes reported seeing a "glowing orange" sky in the distance, which appeared a dark red shade from nearby villages like Killingholme, Stallingborough and Goxhill. READ MORE: [Grimsby painter strangled woman he met on Facebook Dating](https://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/news/grimsby-news/grimsby-painter-strangled-woman-met-9033801?int_source=nba) [Questions over major '40-year' solar farm as campsite owner complains](https://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/news/local-news/questions-over-major-40-year-9031096?int_source=nba) Pictures of the sky were posted across social media, with some residents as far as Hull reporting to have seen the flare from across the River Humber. One Hull resident told [Grimsby Live](https://www.grimsbytelegraph.co.uk/news/grimsby-news/): "It really was intense, it looked like the Eye of Sauron." One Grimsby resident said: "I saw it as I was driving past Tesco in Cleethorpes at about 5pm. It just looked like the sky was lit up, I thought it was a fire at first. It looked really bad from where I was, like the sky was on fire. It was like something you see in a film." "I see it every so often lighting up the sky from my back garden, but on Friday it was brighter than I've ever seen it before," a Goxhill resident said. Prax Lindsey Oil Refinery issued a community update about the increased flaring, and said it was due to the restarting of production units following power outages in the area that day. The full statement reads: "Following localised outages earlier today, we are currently undertaking production unit start-ups which may result in some increased flaring and noise levels. Please be assured that every effort will be made to keep this to a minimum, and we would like to apologise for any inconvenience this may cause. "Should you have any concern on a safety or environmental matter, please contact the refinery on 01469 563 300 to enable us to investigate and respond promptly."

author: ETtoday新聞雲
title: 真人版進擊的巨人！暴走裸男襲擊夾娃娃客　挨K還喊：來釘孤枝
text:
記者許宥孺／高雄報導
高雄一名王姓男子半夜在機台夾娃娃，突然一名全裸男子衝過來，赤手空拳莫名毆打他，如同「進擊的巨人」，王姓男子當下傻眼，試圖要壓制對方，並持手中的安全帽K了對方的頭，沒想到裸男跑回店內穿上衣服，再度衝出店外作勢要攻擊王男。警方到場後，雙方都表示不願提告，不過男子全裸在外趴趴走，最高能開罰6000元。
▲▼真人版進擊的巨人！高雄男夾娃娃遇暴走裸男襲擊。（圖／網友楊小儀提供）
事發在15日凌晨3點多，警方獲報，鳳山區光遠路一家夾娃娃機店發生糾紛，一名男子突然全身脫光光、看似情緒不穩，對夾娃娃機客人進行無差別攻擊。
員警到場時，40歲王姓男子表示，他當時在店內夾娃娃，對方身穿黑色衣服走進來，一直不停地盯著他看，他心裡覺得怪怪的，便決定離開，沒想到走出店外，準備戴上安全帽，一眨眼的時間，對方竟全身脫光光朝他衝過來，不僅賞他巴掌，又對他不停咆哮，拉拉扯扯作勢攻擊，他才會拿安全帽K對方的頭。
全裸的26歲王姓男子則表示，因為看對方不爽才想揍人。不過警方調查，26歲王姓男子是地方頭痛人物，經常在轄區遊蕩，雙方互不認識。經詢後，雙方表示都不願提告傷害，不過警方仍依違反社會秩序維護法第87條第2款裁處，另王男裸露身體部分，也以違反社會秩序維護法第83條第2款裁處，最高可罰6000元。
▲▼裸男穿上衣服後，要王姓男子跟他釘孤枝。（圖／網友楊小儀提供）
莫名遭到毆打的王姓男子，事後透過友人曝光當時的監視器畫面，直呼自己竟遇到真人版「進擊的巨人」，因為裸男全身光溜溜，只有腳上穿著拖鞋，並對他無差別瘋狂的攻擊，他忍無可忍才會拿安全帽K裸男。
沒想到裸男挨打後，還跑回店內穿上衣服，準備再戰第二回合。王男莫名被纏上，對方還要他放下安全帽跟他「釘孤枝」，但最後仍被打趴，只是夾個娃娃機卻遇到進擊的巨人，讓她又好氣又好笑。
▲26歲王姓男子無故襲擊民眾，遭到警方逮捕。（圖／記者許宥孺翻攝）

author: Ashish Verma
title: ‘Beginning of new era for Northeast’: Amit Shah after Centre signs peace deal with ULFA | India
text: New Delhi: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday hailed the signing of a peace deal with the pro-talks faction of the insurgent group ULFA as a new era of peace for the country’s northeastern region which will be free of any disturbance and violence. “This is a new start of a era of peace for the whole Northeast especially Assam. I want to assure ULFA representatives, who have shown trust in the government of India, that a programme will be made from the side of the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) in a time-bound manner to fulfil everything, before you asking for it. Under MHA, a committee will be formed, which will work with the Assam government to fulfil this agreement,” he said. ULFA the oldest insurgent group of Assam agreed to abjure the path of violence. Speaking on the signing of a memorandum of settlement with ULFA. [https://t.co/6H1DIHmmHy] — Amit Shah (@AmitShah) [December 29, 2023] The pro-dialogue faction of the United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA) officially inked a peace agreement with both the Centre and the Assam government, committing to leave the path of violence and integrate into mainstream society. The agreement was signed in the presence of Amit Shah and Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma. The deal came after 12 years of continuing negotiations between the government and the ULFA faction led by Arabinda Rajkhowa. This significant peace deal is expected to bring an end to decades-long insurgency in Assam. ULFA’s hardline faction under the leadership of Paresh Baruah did not participate in the agreement. Baruah is reportedly in an area along the China-Myanmar border. Formed in 1979 with the demand of “sovereign Assam”, ULFA has since been associated with activities considered subversive, prompting the central government to outlaw the group in 1990. The Rajkhowa-led faction commenced peace discussions with the government on September 3, 2011, following the signing of an agreement for Suspension of Operations (SoO) between their faction and the central and state administrations. Read [Latest News](https://www.news9live.com/latest-news) and [Breaking News](https://www.news9live.com/) at News9 Live, Browse for more [India News](https://www.news9live.com/india)

author: Redação
title: Cristiano Ronaldo: «Portugal ganhar um Europeu equivale a um Mundial» :: zerozero.pt
text: [Portugal](https://www.zerozero.pt/equipa/portugal?edicao_id=183453) venceu a [Croácia](https://www.zerozero.pt/equipa/croacia?edicao_id=183453) por [2-1](https://www.zerozero.pt/jogo/2024-09-05-portugal-croacia/9952951) na jornada inaugural da Liga das Nações. [Cristiano Ronaldo](https://www.zerozero.pt/jogador/cristiano-ronaldo) marcou o segundo golo da formação das quinas e não escondeu a emoção. Cristiano Ronaldo em discurso direto: Golo 900: «Foi um golo emocionante para mim. É um número redondo, poderá ser um número fácil, mas não é. Muito trabalho diário, muita consistência, muita preparação. já tenho 39 anos e meio, por isso há que ser muito focado para que as coisas possam correr bem e estar neste nível. É preciso muita dedicação, por isso quando estes recordes vão acontecendo eu fico emocionado porque sei e dou valor àquilo que faço... eu e os meus companheiros obviamente» Companheiros: «Sem eles era impensável, por isso agradecer-lhes e dar os parabéns à equipa. O mais importante foi dar uma resposta diferente daquilo que tinha acontecido no europeu. jogámos bem, a Croácia é um excelente equipa , bateu-se bastante bem e foi um espetáculo de jogo» Mudanças: «Eu senti-me mais livre do que o normal. O mister deu-me essa oportunidade. Jogámos de forma diferente do europeu, fizemos muitas variações, os jogadores andaram mais livres dentro de campo. Eu beneficio com isso, gosto de ser um jogador livre. A equipa teve bastante mobilidade, não foi à toa que o Dalot apareceu a fazer golo». Objetivos: «Portugal ganhar um Europeu equivale a um Mundial. Já ganhei dois troféus por Portugal que queria muito. Não me motivo por isso. Motivo-me por desfrutar do futebol e os recordes aparecem de um forma natural. eu não bato recordes, eles é que me perseguem. Nunca vou ser youtuber. Vou estar ali de vez em quando».

author: Tom Pappert
title: Audio Confirms Amarillo VA Knew Veteran Complained of Sex Between Staff Members in May 2023
text:
Audio recorded by retired U.S. Army Sergeant Donald Belzer, and provided to The Tennessee Star, confirmed through the White House VA Hotline that the Amarillo Veterans Affairs (VA) Health Care System was made aware of the complaint the veteran filed in 2022, when Belzer said he captured video depicting two VA staff members engaged in a sex act inside a clean supplies closet.
Belzer recorded the audio after The Star published the video , recorded by the veteran on August 17, 2022, as the veteran called the White House hotline to obtain copies of the complaints he filed with the Thomas E. Creek VA Medical Center and the White House hotline in August 2022 and April 2023.
A staff member for the hotline, which was established by President-elect Donald Trump in 2019, a note was entered to Belzer’s April 27 complaint by Amarillo VA staff on May 1, confirming the veteran notified the federal agency of the alleged sex act between its employees.
Reading from the May 1 note, the hotline staff member told Belzer, “On August 17 of 2022, at 12:53, the veteran was in the Emergency Room at the VA Medical Center and saw two staff members having sex in a clean linen closet.”
Despite confirming the content of the May 1 note applied to Belzer’s complaint, the staff member additionally told the veteran the text of the May 1 note could only be provided by the Thomas E. Creek
Documents obtained by Belzer after completing a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking information from the Amarillo VA appear to be missing the note acknowledging his complaint alleging two staff members engaged in a sex act inside a closet just feet away from him.
The Star contacted the Amarillo VA, which confirmed after the video was published that it is investigating the alleged sex act , to confirm it still holds the April complaint and clarify whether the investigation began before or after Belzer sent the video to The Star .
Belzer told The Star he sent the video after learning of the ongoing probe in the U.S. House Veterans Affairs committee investigating allegations of sex at the workplace at a VA health care center in Johnson City, Tennessee, which Breitbart News recently reported sparked a series of resignations, including from one man who apparently resigned after investigators determined he engaged in sex acts with 32 employees.
– – –
Tom Pappert is the lead reporter for The Tennessee Star , and also reports for The Pennsylvania Daily Star and The Arizona Sun Times . Follow Tom on X/Twitter . Email tips to pappert.tom@proton.me.

author: Murcia.com
title: Cartagena por la Caridad celebra su 18 cumpleaños, repartiendo 22.850 € en donativos - Cartagena - murcia.com
text: La parroquia de San Gines de la Jara donde recibe culto el Patrón de Cartagena acogió la entrega de donativos de la XVII edición de Cartagena por la Caridad, a las asociaciones e instituciones beneficiarias en esta edición. El presidente de Cartagena por la Caridad, Matías Barco inicio el turno de palabras, haciendo una exposición del recorrido realizado por esta iniciativa apostólica nacida el 28 de diciembre de 2005. Aquel día no fue una inocentada recaudar 27.711,87 €, cuando el reto, era conseguir los 7.000 € que costaba arreglar la vieja caldera del Asilo de Ancianos de las Hermanitas de los Pobres, hoy tampoco es una inocentada, que Cartagena por la Caridad y al cumplirse el 18 aniversario del nacimiento de esta obra de Dios, podamos repartir 22.850,08 €, correspondientes a esta decimoséptima edición, apuntaba el presidente. Los beneficiarios han sido, las niñas Patricia Pinero Castillo, afectada por un craneofaringioma, Alba Mota Fernández, afectada por un aneurisma en la vena galeno del cerebro, y el pequeño Lucas Pérez López, afectado por el síndrome deleción 1P36, a ellos han correspondido los donativos de la famosa pulsera "El Amor lo explica todo", que se puso a la venta en el mes de junio, convirtiéndose en la pulsera de moda del verano. Beneficiarios también ha sido, FOAL (Fundación ONCE de Ayuda a Latinoamérica) -Grupo Social ONCE-, en la municipalidad de Camotán (Guatemala) para mujeres y niñas con discapacidad visual, la directora de la ONCE en Cartagena, Gemma Pozo, ha recogido el donativo procedente de la plantación de arboles llevada a cabo por Cartagena por la Caridad, dentro de la campaña "Plantando Vida, Sembrando Esperanza". Hermanitas de los Pobres de Cartagena, Junta Local de Cartagena de la AECC, AFA LEVANTE, "La Resi" de ASTUS, TP Cartagena RM y Autismo Somos Todos, han recogido los beneficios del histórico Concierto que protagonizaron la Unidad de Música del Tercio de Levante de Cartagena y la Banda Sinfónica de la Policía Nacional, junto a los Tenores Ángel Cortes y el cartagenero Pablo Martínez. Los donativos también han llegado al proyecto internacional que Cartagena por la Caridad tiene en Perú, concretamente en la capital, Lima, en Huaraz, Pucallpa, y Orellana, estas dos últimas en plena selva peruana, donde han sido atendidas 300 personas pobres entre ancianos y niños. La Concejala de Servicios Sociales, Familia e Igualdad, Cristina Mora, destacó la importantísima labor que Cartagena por la Caridad viene desarrollando desde hace dieciocho años en la ciudad, una iniciativa consolidada en Cartagena y reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. El Ayuntamiento, siempre estará con vosotros, apuntó la Concejala de Servicios Sociales. Una emocionada Cristina Mora, manifestó sentirse muy contenta de haber podido tomar parte en los actos organizados en esta edición y cuyos resultados económicos son todo un éxito en favor de asociaciones e instituciones de la ciudad, agradeciendo a su vez, que San Juan Pablo II, fijara sus ojos en Cartagena para que naciera esta obra. También trasladó a los presentes la felicitación de la Alcaldesa Noelia Arroyo.

author: Виталий Лукин
title: Кто мучает собак в Подмосковье? Жестокие случаи в Воскресенске и Шатуре - nsk.om1.ru
text:
В Подмосковье продолжаются случаи жестокого обращения с животными, в частности с бродячими собаками. Жители городов Воскресенск и Шатура сообщают о случаях насилия, когда животных находят с ожогами, ранами и изуродованными мордами. Одну из таких собак нашли местные жители на территории одного из СНТ в Воскресенске. Раненое животное обнаружили с опухолью на шее, ранами на лапах и шее, которое, по всей видимости, было обливано кислотой. Об этом сообщает REGIONS.
Зоозащитники и неравнодушные местные жители организовали сбор средств для лечения и временной передержки собаки, которая в данный момент находится под присмотром волонтеров. После окончания курса лечения животному планируют найти нового хозяина.
В Шатуре был зафиксирован еще один случай жестокого обращения с собакой. Животное пришло к людям, очевидно в поисках помощи. На теле пса — сильные ожоги, покрывающие лапы и почти всю морду. Очевидцы утверждают, что его облили химическим веществом. Животное также страдало от повреждений легких и травм.
Сотрудники приюта для животных в Мишеронском «Чертог волка» приняли пострадавшего пса, а зоозащитники отмечают, что несмотря на тяжелые переживания, собака идет на поправку. Волонтеры также придумали для него кличку — Феникс, символизируя возрождение и новую жизнь.
По словам психолога Ильи Ахмедова, жестокое обращение с животными может быть признаком серьезных психологических нарушений у человека, таких как садизм или психопатия. Эксперт также предупреждает, что такие люди могут представлять угрозу для общества в целом, особенно если их агрессия распространяется на людей.
В России за жестокое обращение с животными предусмотрена уголовная ответственность. Статья 245 Уголовного кодекса РФ предусматривает различные виды наказания, включая штрафы, обязательные работы и лишение свободы до трех лет. В случае отягчающих обстоятельств, таких как совершение преступления группой лиц или в присутствии малолетних, наказание может быть более строгим.
Адвокаты и зоозащитники настоятельно рекомендуют жителям Подмосковья не оставаться равнодушными к подобным инцидентам и обращаться в полицию.

author: Orysia Hrudka
title: Ukraine forces neutralize half of New Year's eve Russia drone assault, three Ukrainian oblasts affected - Euromaidan Press
text: As the New Year approached, Ukrainian forces successfully [thwarted](https://t.me/kpszsu/9170) 21 out of 49 combat drones deployed by Russian forces across Ukrainian territories. Yuriy Ihnat, spokesperson for the Ukrainian Air Force, revealed during a morning telethon, “On the night of December 31, 2023, Russian aggressors unleashed ‘Shahed’ UAVs from three directions: Cape Chauda (Crimea), the Primorsko-Akhtarsk district, and the Kursk region of the Russian Federation.” A total of 49 Russian unmanned aerial vehicles, identified as “Shahed-136/131,” were recorded. The adversary also targeted Kharkiv with six guided missiles from the S-300 air defense system. Most of the combat drones were directed towards the front lines of defense and civilian, military, and infrastructural targets in Kharkiv, Kherson, Mykolayiv, and Zaporizhzhia. Across various regions of Ukraine, mobile fire groups of Defense Forces, fighter aviation, and anti-aircraft missile units successfully neutralized 21 Russian “Shahed” drones. “Out of approximately 3,800 drones launched by Russia since September 2022, around 3,000 have been eliminated by the Ukrainian Defense Forces during the full-scale war,” added Ihnat. The Southern Defense Forces of Ukraine reported that the drone attack persisted for seven hours. One “Shahed” was neutralized in Mykolayiv Oblast, six in Odesa Oblast, with debris falling into coastal zones. In Kherson Oblast, private residences suffered damage due to drone impacts. Ihnat also highlighted that Russia targeted Kharkiv with six S-300 missiles on Saturday evening, striking a hotel and other civilian structures. Additionally, he underscored the successful neutralization of X-59 missiles in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast the day before. Damage caused by drone attacks in Kherson and Odesa oblasts During the night of December 31, Kherson Oblast [experienced](https://t.me/SJTF_Odes/4729) impacts from “Shahed” drones, resulting in damage to several private residences. Simultaneously, near Odesa, a coastal area witnessed a fire caused by the debris of a downed drone. According to the Southern Defense Forces of Ukraine, the assault involving unmanned aerial vehicles of the “Shahed-131/136” type, initiated by Russia earlier in the evening, persisted for a duration of seven hours. The attack originated from the temporarily occupied Crimea and the eastern coastline of the Azov Sea, targeting southern regions. Details provided by the Southern Defense Forces state, “Anti-aircraft defense units efficiently responded in Mykolayiv and Odesa, successfully neutralizing 1 and 6 ‘Shahed’ drones, respectively.” However, impacts could not be averted in Kherson Oblast, where several private residences in the Tiahynska community suffered damage. In Odesa Oblast, debris from the Russian UAV caused a fire in the coastal zone of the Odesa district, promptly extinguished by emergency response teams. No information regarding casualties or injuries has been reported at this time. Kyiv Oblast: аire breaks out at a critical infrastructure site In the night of December 31, Kyiv Oblast activated its anti-aircraft defense forces, successfully repelling Russian drone attack. A fire broke out at a critical infrastructure site as a result of the Russian assault. As per the latest information, there have been no reported impacts on residential infrastructure, and no casualties or injuries have been recorded. Details indicate that due to the attack on one of the critical infrastructure sites, a fire erupted in the open area, promptly extinguished through operational efforts. According to Ruslan Kravchenko, Head of Kyiv Oblast Military Administration, “Kyiv Oblast thwarted another terrorist attack by the enemy. Tonight, the Oblast was targeted by combat drones, and our air defense forces were actively engaged. Grateful to them for their professional work.” He emphasized, “Even on the eve of the New Year, the enemy persists in carrying out terrorist attacks. Therefore, I urge every resident of Kyiv Oblast not to ignore the danger. During air raid signals, it is crucial to be in a safe place. Take this seriously. Stay vigilant.” [Russian strikes claim lives in Kharkiv Oblast: two dead recovered from rubble in Borova, 28 injured]

author: Deidre McPhillips, CNN
title: US overdoses have fallen sharply in recent months, a hopeful shift in trends
text: (CNN) — Federal data shows that overdose deaths in the United States are the lowest they’ve been in three years, and a new analysis suggests that some downward trends indicate “unprecedented” progress in the fight against the drug epidemic. Overdose deaths soared during the height of the Covid-19 pandemic, jumping 30% between 2019 and 2020 and another 16% by the end of 2021, according to data from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. But the latest provisional data shows that overdose deaths made a sharp turn at the end of last year and have been trending down for months. There were about 101,000 overdose deaths in the year ending in April, CDC estimates. There are still far more lives being lost now than before the pandemic – in 2019, there were about 72,000 fatal overdoses – but the latest data shows that deaths dropped a marked 10% in one year and are the lowest they’ve been since the spring of 2021. A steep drop in deaths from fentanyl is a key factor driving the overall decline. Overdose deaths involving fentanyl and other synthetic opioids are down 20% year-over-year, CDC data shows. These drugs are now involved in about two-thirds of all fatal overdoses, down from more than three-quarters of all overdose deaths a year ago. “An opportunity to feel hopeful after so many years of watching the death toll tick up and up is wonderful,” said Dr. Sarah Wakeman, senior medical director for substance use disorder at Mass General Brigham. “I think also it’s important to note that there are still more people dying from overdose than before the pandemic, and we’re still stratospherically higher than we should be in terms of people dying from a preventable cause of death.” In a deep dive into the trends, street drug scientist Nabarun Dasgupta and colleagues at the University of North Carolina found that non-fatal overdoses have also fallen significantly and that trends are relatively consistent at the state level – all signs that help experts feel that the overall trend is solid. Data compiled by the CDC on the rate of emergency department visits for overdoses shows a 24% year-over-year decline in April and a 13% annual decline through June. And data from 911 calls and other emergency medical services responses suggests that non-fatal opioid overdoses are about 17% lower this month than they were in September of last year. “A 15-20% decrease in non-fatal overdose and a 10% decrease in fatal overdose is a major impact. There is barely any public health intervention that has credibly achieved this magnitude of decrease,” Dasgupta and his colleagues wrote in an analysis published Wednesday on the website for the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Street Drug Analysis Lab. “Our conclusion is that the dip in overdoses is real, and not a data artifact. It remains to be seen how long it will be sustained. If it is sustained, whatever caused it would be one of the strongest ‘interventions’ ever witnessed in this domain of public health,” they wrote. “Yet, -15% to -20% decreases in overdose would be unprecedented. To our knowledge, no public health intervention in the United States has ever achieved this benchmark.” There is not one single factor that can explain the rapid decrease or its timing, experts say. Instead, it’s probably the result of a wide range of persistent efforts starting to make an impact. “If this is real – and I hope that it’s real and will continue – it’s because of the sustained efforts of many different multilayered interventions,” Wakeman said, citing interventions such as expanded access to naloxone to reverse overdoses, flexibilities with medications to treat opioid use disorder and promotion of fentanyl test strips . “Finally treating this like a public health condition after so many years of effort and attention may be starting to pay off.” John Pamplin, an assistant professor of epidemiology at Columbia University who researches the effects of structural racism on substance use outcomes, said that there is a cyclical nature to the drug crisis in the US: Changes to the drug supply and new patterns in drug use require adaptations to knowledge and interventions, all of which takes time. In fact, the CDC has categorized the opioid epidemic into three waves : the first spurred by the rise in prescription opioid overdoses that started in the 1990s, followed by a rise in heroin overdose deaths that started in 2010 and the latest involving synthetic opioids that started in 2013. “We’ve been riding a better than 20-year peak in terms of the continuous increases of drug overdoses,” Pamplin said. “Generally speaking, you have these kind of rises and falls. It may be time that these are true declines.” Although a 10% decline in overdose deaths may be unprecedented, Pamplin notes that the amount of support for change and intervention has also reached new levels. “I think it shows why it’s important to actually give harm reduction approaches time to bear out, not only to have those potential effects take place but also enough time for us to fairly evaluate the policies to see if they are, in fact, working,” he said. In any case, the magnitude of change signals a “very strong acting force,” Dasgupta and colleagues wrote. “Something has changed. And that this is happening without central coordination is a big deal. It had major implications for the way we think about overdose prevention interventions.” Still, experts warn that it’s not time to be complacent. While national data shows a promising trend, it could obscure growing disparities in the burden of the drug overdose epidemic and populations that need particular attention. “Unfortunately, for the most affected groups, namely native Americans and Black American men, the death rates are not decreasing and are at the highest recorded levels,” said Dr. Nora Volkow, director of the National Institute on Drug Abuse at the National Institutes of Health. “Understanding the causes for the different trends in overdose mortality is needed to tailor implementation and support of evidence-based strategies to prevent and reduce deaths. We must continue to prioritize efforts to prevent drug use, treat addiction, provide access to lifesaving harm-reduction services and support people in recovery that are equitable and accessible to everyone who would benefit from them.” The-CNN-Wire ™ & © 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.
